com.yantra.api.ysc.overrides

Interface checkValidationRule

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface checkValidationRule
    Evaulate validation rules to determine if any have been violated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document checkValidationRule(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The checkValidationRule API evaluates all applicable Validation Rules for a Validation, and determines if a Transaction should be allowed or not.

    • Method Detail

      • checkValidationRule

        org.w3c.dom.Document checkValidationRule(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        The checkValidationRule API evaluates all applicable Validation Rules for a Validation, and determines if a Transaction should be allowed or not.

        All applicable rules of the specified Validation that match the input criteria will be evaluated for potential violations. If a rule is found to be violated,

        the API will return a value of N for the AllowTransaction field of the output. If no rules are found to be violated, the field

        will be returned with a value of Y. Please see the manageValidationRule API for information concerning rule inheritance from configuration.

        Validation Domain

        The checkValidationRule will perform its regular operations as long as the specified Validation's Domain is enabled. In the event that the Domain

        is disabled, the API will not evaluate any rules and will return a value of Y for the AllowTransaction field of the output.

        External Validation

        In the event that the specified Validation has its External_Init_Performed flag set to Y, the API will search for all applicable

        rules that match the input criteria. If any rules are found, none will be evaluated and the AllowTransaction field will have a value of N.

        If no rules are found, the AllowTransaction will have a value of Y. In this scenario, the Validation's External_Init_Performed

        flag is used to indicate when External Validation is taking place in the in the business logic, and checkValidationRule should alter its behavior to return the

        AllowTransaction field with Y or N based on whether or not any applicable rules exist.

        Configuration Group Filtering

        If the specified Validation has a ConfigurationGroup that corresponds to a YFS_Base_Config_Grp_Defn record that has filtering enabled, the

        rules used in Greex evaluation will be filtered before processing. All active rules found using the passed input criteria will be subject to filtering based on the

        configured Region Schema for the Enterprise. Please see the Product Overview and Configuring basic settings of Documentation for further information.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exit if Is_User_Exit_Active is set on the Input Validation:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalDataForValidationUE

          Events Raised: None

          Audits: None

          Pre-conditions: None

          Post-conditions: None

          Output Template Support: Yes

          Database Extensibility Support: No

          Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

          Additional Information:

          The results of the API's validation operation are returned via the field "AllowTransaction", which returns either a 'Y' or 'N' based on the situation.

          1. In General Usage, AllowTransaction will be set to 'Y' if no violations are found, and conversely, will be set 'N' if any violations are found.

          2. If the Validation Domain of the given Validation is disabled, then no evaluation will be done, and AllowTransaction will be set to 'Y'.

          3. If the Validation's "External_Init_Perform" flag is set to 'Y', denoting that validation is to be performed outside of the Manager Overides Framework,

          then AllowTransaction will be determined by the number of applicable Validation Rules found; 'Y' if none are found, and 'N' if one or more are found.

        Parameters:
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
